member.name: T:Eastwood.Http.HttpAction
member.summary: Encapsulates the work to perform an HTTP action upon a resource.

remarks.para: The HttpAction forms the primary class of the Eastwoodâ„¢ ASP.NET MVC action mini-framework.

First, a fast-acting TryGetLocalConditionInfoAsync method is called, which seeks out any versioning information stored on the server, before any preconditions are checked and if met, a powerful second ExecuteActionAsync mechanism comes into play to drive the action home.
See how this ground-breaking new design is transforming ASP.NET MVC web projects today.

member.summary: Determines the best default precondition behavior for the HTTP method.

member.summary: Builds a precondition.
member.param: The default result should the requisite headers not be present; usually a reads should pass and writes should fail.
member.exception: Cannot execute method. The required property Request is a null reference.
Unable to build a predicate for the request. The HTTP method is not supported.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: A standard result to indicate that the precondition passed and that server-side execution should continue.

member.summary: A standard result to indicate a 412 Precondition Failed response should be given.

member.summary: A standard result to indicate a 304 Not Modified should be given.

member.summary: A standard result to indicate a 428 precondition required response should be given.

member.summary: A standard result to indicate a 400 bad request response should be given.

member.summary: The various statuses of a precondition check.

member.summary: Unable to determine the precondition, usually due to missing information in the request.

member.summary: The conditions on the request passed.

member.name: F:Eastwood.Http.PreconditionResultStatus.Failed
member.summary: The conditions on the request were not met.
